pages:
STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 6, 2025
Mark Jones
Osceola Youth Center
3030 Long Lane Rd,
Evart, MI, 49639
Re: License #: CI670414130
SI #: 2025SIC0000509
Dear Mr. Jones:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager Rorie Dodge-Pifer at (517) 899-6024.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
*** This report contains quoted profanity***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000509
Special Investigation Intake Date: March 28, 2025
License #: CI670414130
Licensee Group Organization: Youth Opportunity Investments, LLC
Licensee Designee: Michael Cantrell
Chief Administrator: Mark Jones
Agency Name: Osceola Youth Center
Agency Address: 3030 Long Lane Rd
Evart, MI 49639
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 11/08/2026
Capacity: 16
II. METHODOLOGY
Contact Date Contact Method Contact Purpose
4/23/2025 Phone Interview
4/18/2025 Email Documentation received or sent
4/16/2025 Phone Interview
4/16/2025 Phone Interview
4/16/2025 Phone Interview
4/16/2025 Phone Interview
4/11/2025 Email Documentation received or sent
4/10/2025 Onsite Inspection Announced Visit; Documentation received
or sent; Interview
4/7/2025 Onsite Inspection Documentation received or sent;
Unannounced Visit; Interview
4/4/2025 Video Conference Other
4/1/2025 Documentation Other
3/31/2025 Phone Other; Special Investigation Initiation
1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents' needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff cuss at children.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 5 was interviewed via telephone on 3/31/2025. Staff 5
reported Youth D told Chief Administrator Staff 1 called Staff 5 a
“fucking bitch”. Staff 5 reported “all staff” swear at the youth at the
facility and provided one example of Staff 2 stating “I don’t give a
fuck about the girls” in front of the female youth. Staff 5 was
unable to provide specific youth who were present when Staff 2
made the statement. Staff 5 was unable to provide any other
examples of staff swearing at youth. Staff 5 reported youth swear
at one another “all the time” at the facility.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/7/2025. Youth A reported staff do not swear at youth or in front
of youth at the facility. Youth A did not want to talk any further.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/7/2025. Youth B reported staff do not swear in front of youth or
at youth at the facility. Youth B reported youth are not allowed to
swear at the facility, but some youth do. Youth B reported when
youth swear at the facility, they loose points to use at the points
store to buy items.
Youth B reported Staff 1 has told youth the facility is haunted as a
youth “hung themself here prior to the facility previously closing”.
Youth B reported Staff 5 was fired from the facility for pushing
Staff 1 out of the doorway. Youth B reported she did not see Staff
5 push Staff 1 however heard about it from other youth. Youth B
was unable to recall who told her Staff 5 pushed Staff 1.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/7/2025. Youth C reported “certain” staff have sworn in front of
youth at the facility, however, most staff do not swear. Youth C
reported she has heard Staff 2 and Staff 3 swear at the facility on
2

occasion. Youth C reported she has heard Staff 2 and Staff 3 say
“the s word and f bomb”.
Youth D was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/7/2025. Youth D reported staff at the facility are “immature”.
Youth D reported he heard Staff 1, Staff 4, Assistant Facility
Administrator, and Chief Administrator swear at the facility. Youth
D could not recall specific examples of when Staff 4 and Assistant
Facility Administrator swore. Youth D reported Chief
Administrator called him “an impatient little shit” however was
unable to recall when. Youth D reported no one was around when
Chief Administrator called him “an impatient little shit”. Youth D
reported Staff 1 and Staff 5 do not get along and one day Staff 1
said “where’s that bitch at” referring to Staff 5 as lunch was late.
Youth D reported when lunch arrived Staff 1 stated “this food
tastes like ass”. Youth D reported Staff 1 is immature and made
the statement to get attention.
Youth D reported Staff 4 threatened to beat him up one to two
months ago while Youth D was in his bedroom. Youth D did not
recall anyone else around to hear Staff 4 say this to him. Youth D
reported Staff 4 said this to scare him and made the statement to
him in his bedroom as there are no cameras in the bedrooms.
Youth D reported Staff 4 also threatened to drag him behind his
truck while once in the classroom. Youth D reported Staff 4 was
joking with him when he said this as Staff 4 also told him he would
give Youth D his truck keys so he would not have to deal with him.
Youth D reported Staff 4 made the statements in the classroom to
get him to laugh as Staff 4 was joking with him however Youth D
describe the behavior as “immature”.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/7/2025. Youth E reported staff at the facility are respectful and
professional. Youth E reported he has never heard any staff
swear at the facility. Youth E reported youth are not supposed to
swear at the facility and if youth do they get marked down after
one warning.
Youth F was interviewed via telephone on 4/18/2025. Youth F
reported she was previously placed at Osceola Youth Center.
Youth F reported Staff 8 was an employee at the facility, however,
was fired. Youth F reported Staff 1 was young and immature and
“didn’t know how to watch his mouth as he would say the N word”.
Youth F reported Staff 2 and Staff 6 also made inappropriate
comments while she was at the facility and provided the example
of jokingly saying “they would break kids arms in restraints”.
3

Youth F reported Staff 2 and Staff 6 were not serious, however felt
it was very unprofessional.
Chief Administrator was interviewed via telephone on
4/7/2025 and face-to-face on 4/10/2025. Chief Administrator
reported he recently terminated a kitchen manager and believed
the allegations were retaliation. Chief Administrator reported he
was unaware of any staff swearing at or in front of any youth at
the facility. Chief Administrator reported there is “zero tolerance”
for the behavior at the facility. Chief Administrator denied any
knowledge of Staff 1 telling youth another staff was a “fucking
bitch” or Staff 2 making any statements of “I hate these fucking
girls”. Chief Administrator reported Youth D never told him Staff 1
was calling Staff 5 a “bitch”. Chief Administrator reported he has
never called Youth D “an impatient little shit” however stated he
did tell Youth D he was being impatient as Youth D tends to hang
out in his office and Chief Administrator was not available when
Youth D was constantly asking for him. Chief Administrator was
not aware of any staff telling youth at the facility anything related
to the facility being haunted or any youth or staff dying while at the
facility. Chief Administrator reported he has never heard anything
about a former youth hanging themselves at the facility, a former
staff dying at the facility or anything about a little girl named
“Dorothy” haunting the facility. Chief Administrator reported during
a staff dinner off grounds, staff were talking about the facility being
haunted as some odd things had occurred including a marker
moving across a room however did not hear anything else.
Chief Administrator reported Staff 5 did push Staff 1 in front of
youth however he did not recall which youth were present. Chief
Administrator reported Staff 5 was terminated from the facility.
Clinical Director was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/7/2025. Clinical Director reported staff at the facility are
professional and continue to grow and develop in their verbal de-
escalation skills. Clinical Director reported she has never heard
any staff swear at or in front of any youth at the facility when she
has been present. Clinical Director reported youth are redirected
when they swear at the facility as youth are being prepared for
living in the community and are learning appropriate social skills.
Clinical Director reported youth are not supposed to swear at the
facility, however, do at times and staff redirect youth.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/7/2025.
Staff 1 reported she prompts youth at the facility not to swear.
Staff 1 reported she has caught herself slipping and beginning to
swear at the facility in front of the youth however corrects herself.
4

Staff 1 provided the example of she has said “I gotta go take a
piss” and then will correct herself and say “I mean pee”. Staff 1
denied ever making any statements regarding “where is that bitch”
or “the food tastes like ass”. Staff 1 denied ever swearing at any
staff at the facility. Staff 1 reported she had issues with Staff 5.
Staff 1 reported Staff 5 told her the boys, she believed Youth D,
told Staff 5 she called Staff 5 a “bitch”. Staff 1 denied this. Staff 1
reported a couple weeks ago Staff 5 served breakfast with no
issues, however at lunch Staff 5 pushed her out of the kitchen.
Staff 1 said she reported the incident to administration and
administration internally handled the situation as Staff 5 was
released from employment. Staff 1 reported Staff 5 pushed her
out of the kitchen in front of Youth B, Youth C, and Staff 6.
Staff 1 reported Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 6 have told youth about
the facility being haunted as a former youth hung themself at the
facility, a former staff passed away on one of the units, and stories
about a girl named “Dorothy” who haunts the facility. Staff 1
reported she has not told the youth about the facility being
haunted, however has heard Staff 3, Staff 4, and Staff 6 tell youth
stories.
Staff 2 was interviewed via telephone on 4/16/2025. Staff 2
reported she has not heard any staff swear at or in front of any
youth at the facility. Staff 2 reported she never made any
statements pertaining to “I hate these fucking girls” and denied
ever making any statements about restraining youth to “bash their
heads into the wall”.
Staff 2 reported she has heard staff say the facility is haunted.
Staff 2 reported Supervisor in a joking manner once told the youth
there was a ghost at the facility. Staff 2 reported she did not recall
when Supervisor stated this, nor did she recall the youth who
Supervisor told. Staff 2 reported she has never heard any other
staff at the facility tell any youth about the facility being haunted.
Staff 2 reported no concerns at the facility.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/7/2025
and via telephone on 4/16/2025. Staff 3 reported staff
expectations at the facility are to be good role models for the
youth. Staff 3 reported staff are not supposed to swear at or in
front of youth at the facility. Staff 3 reported he has “slipped a few
times” and sworn at the facility. Staff 3 provided examples of on
one occasion a youth scared him, and he said, “oh shit”. Staff 3
reported he could not recall specific situations, but it was possible
that he could have said the “f bomb”. Staff 3 reported he has
heard staff slip and swear however he has never heard any staff
5

swear at any youth. Staff 3 reported he has never heard any staff
say, “I hate these fucking girls”. Staff 3 reported he heard fellow
staff talking about other staff and supervisors and swear in
frustration when youth are in the room or vicinity of the
conversation. Staff 3 provided the example of hearing “I think this
shits so stupid” but could not recall who said it.
Staff 3 reported he heard rumors about the facility being haunted.
Staff 3 said he did tell youth when he first started that previous
other youth who had been at the facility had seen a little girl ghost
by the name “Dorothy” who wanted to be their friend at the facility.
Staff 3 could not recall who he told. Staff 3 reported Supervisor
talked to him about this when he first started and told him not to
tell youth and he has not told any youth since. Staff 3 reported
youth at the facility will talk about things they have seen that are
unusual in terms of the facility being haunted, and he will validate
the youth by stating he has heard similar things from other youth.
Staff 3 provided an example of a situation that occurred Sunday
night when all, but one youth were asleep. The one youth who
was awake was off the pod in the administration building with
other staff and Staff 3 witnessed the youth’s bedroom light turning
on and off when no one was in the room. Staff 3 reported he
heard rumors of a former youth hanging themself at the facility
and a former staff dying of natural causes at the facility years ago,
however Staff 3 reported he never told any youth about this. Staff
3 reported he heard youth talk about “Dorothy”, the former youth
and former staff, however he did not tell the youth and does not
know how the youth heard about it.
Staff 4 was interviewed via telephone on 4/16/2025. Staff 4
reported staff at the facility “absolutely” swear at and in front of
youth at the facility. Staff 4 reported Staff 2 and Staff 6 have
made statements that they “like to restrain youth so they can bash
their heads off the wall.” Staff 4 reported he has cussed at the
facility around youth and provided the example of saying “shit”.
Staff 4 reported he had no other examples or specific staff he has
heard swear at or in front of youth at the facility. Staff 4 denied
ever making any threatening statements to Youth D regarding
beating Youth D up in his bedroom. Staff 4 reported he has told
Youth D not to aggravate other youth at the facility as the youth
will “beat him up”. Staff 4 denied ever making any statements to
Youth D regarding dragging him behind his truck or any
statements of giving Youth D his truck keys so that he does not
have to deal with Youth D.
6

Staff 4 reported he heard the facility is haunted and youth have
informed him there is a little girl in a white dress however Staff 4
was unable to recall the name of the little girl in the white dress.
Staff 4 reported he told youth at the facility that the facility is on an
old Indian burial ground. Staff 4 reported he heard staff say the
facility is haunted and staff agree with youth when the youth talk
about the facility being haunted. Staff 4 reported “a lot” of staff
have said the facility was haunted, but was not able to provide any
specific staff names. Staff 4 reported when he started at the
facility and was provided a tour, he was informed that a youth
years ago hung themself at the facility. Staff 4 reported he has
never told youth this nor has he heard any youth talk about this.
Staff 4 reported a former staff did pass away at the facility
however he has never heard any youth talk about this.
Staff 4 reported concerns regarding the facility having a former
staff who was attempting to have a relationship with a former
youth (this is being addressed under SI 2025SIC0000567).
Staff 6 was interviewed via telephone on 4/23/2025. Staff 6
reported there is a “zero tolerance” for staff swearing at the facility
and staff will be asked to clock out if they do swear. Staff 6
reported she has never heard any staff swear at or in front of
youth at the facility and denied ever doing so herself. Staff 6
reported she has never made any statements regarding “liking to
restrain youth to bash their heads into the wall” or anything in
regards, even in a joking manner, about breaking youth arms in
restraints. Staff 6 reported she has no knowledge of any staff
telling youth at the facility anything related to the facility being
haunted. Staff 6 reported she has never heard any staff or youth
talk about a former youth hanging themself at the facility, a former
staff dying at the facility, or anything about a ghost named
“Dorothy”. Staff 6 reported she has never heard Staff 1 call any
staff a “fucking bitch” at the facility or refer to any staff as that to
any youth. Staff 6 reported Staff 1 is the least confrontational
person at the facility. Staff 6 denied ever hearing Staff 2 say any
statements related to “I hate these fucking girls” at the facility.
Staff 7 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/10/2025. Staff 7 reported she has no knowledge of staff
swearing at or in front of youth at the facility. Staff 7 reported if
she ever heard a staff swear at or in front of a youth at the facility
that she would address the behavior.
Staff 7 reported she was present and witnessed Staff 5 push Staff
1 out of the kitchen in front of Youth A and Youth B. Staff 7
reported Staff 5 told Staff 1 to get out of the kitchen and started
7

pushing Staff 1 back out of the kitchen. Staff 7 reported she
advised Staff 1 to write a staff grievance about the incident.
Staff 7 reported she has not heard anything regarding any staff
telling any youth that the facilities is haunted. Staff 7 reported she
has heard staff talking about “weird noises and situations” they
have experienced at the facility.
Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
4/10/2025. Supervisor reported he has never heard staff swear at
or in front of youth at the facility and if he did, he would correct the
staff.
Supervisor reported some staff say the facility is haunted as there
have been times where the lights will turn on and off and doors will
open and close without someone doing it. Supervisor reported a
youth hung themself at the facility a little over twenty years ago
and a former staff passed away at the facility while working on
shift. Supervisor reported some say there is a little “ghost girl” by
the name “Dorothy” that walks around the facility. Supervisor
reported youth at the facility have asked about these incidents
because “everybody talks about it”. Supervisor denied ever telling
any youth about these incidents. Supervisor reported youth at the
facility have asked him about these incidents and that he only
says that he has heard about it but he has not provided any youth
with any specific information regarding the incidents.
Assistant Facility Administrator was interviewed face-to-face
at the facility on 4/10/2025. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported he has no knowledge of any staff swearing at or in front
of youth at the facility. Assistant Facility Administrator reported
the facility highly discourages swearing. Assistant Facility
Administrator reported he “may have” sworn while in the
medication office and kids “may have” heard him however that
would be the only situation where youth would have heard him
swear.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported he did not witness the
incident however he was told by Staff 5 she was upset with Staff 1
due to a youth, unknown who, telling Staff 5 that Staff 1 called her
a “bitch” over ranch dressing. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported he spoke with Youth D and Youth D informed him Staff 1
was talking about Staff 5 however nothing about calling Staff 5 a
“bitch”. Assistant Facility Administrator reported he talked to Staff
5 and told Staff 5 to “squash” the issue. Assistant Facility
Administrator reported he left the facility that day after speaking
with Staff 5 for an appointment and when he returned later in the
8

day Staff 1 came to him and informed him Staff 5 had pushed her
in the kitchen in front of youth. Assistant Facility Administrator
reported he spoke with Staff 1, Staff 5, Staff 7, Youth A, and Youth
B regarding the allegations of Staff 5 pushing Staff 1 and Staff 5
was demoted from her positioned due to this. Assistant Facility
Administrator reported after this, Staff 5 was acting unprofessional
as she was “weaponizing” the youth by telling youth that she was
demoted due to Staff 1 and Youth A got upset and was
demanding Staff 5 be given her position back. Assistant Facility
Administrator reported as a result of the situations, Staff 5 was
released from employment at the facility.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported he has heard the facility
is haunted and some staff believe this to be true. Assistant
Facility Administrator reported he is not aware of any former youth
hanging themself at the facility or any knowledge of a little girl
named “Dorthy”. Assistant Facility Administrator reported he
heard a former staff did pass away on shift from natural causes.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported no knowledge of staff
telling youth about the facility being haunted.
Assistant Facility Administrator reported no concerns with Staff 4
and no concerns with Staff 4 making inappropriate statements to
Youth D.
Documents Reviewed:
• Youth Opportunity Employee Handbook Standards of
Conduct: Staff are always expected to maintain ethical and
professional behavior. This includes the expectation that
staff are to interact with youth in a manner promoting their
emotional and physical safety while incorporating trauma
responsive practices. Unacceptable behavior of staff in the
workplace includes fighting or threatening violence in the
workplace, boisterous or disruptive activity in the
workplace, and behavior that is unprofessional, unethical or
abusive.
• Youth Opportunity Employee Handbook Special Facility
Concerns: While on duty no employee shall use profane or
abusive language. All conversations with youth shall be
strictly professional.
• Youth Opportunity Employee Grievance form dated
3/17/2025 completed by Staff 1: Staff 1 went into the
kitchen to get water and Staff 5 told Staff 1 to get out and
Staff 1 was not allowed in Staff 5’s kitchen in front of youth.
Staff 5 pushed Staff 1 out of the kitchen in front of the
youth.
9

• Employee Separation Report for Staff 5 dated 3/26/2025:
Staff 5 went into Willow Hall and told youth she had been
demoted forty-five minutes after receiving disciplinary
action due to an employee grievance investigation. This
caused disruptive behavior on the unit that put the safety of
youth and staff at risk. This behavior violates the
Standards of Conduct Employee Handbook:
Insubordination or other disrespectful conduct, violation of
safety or health rules, behavior that is unprofessional,
unethical, or abusive, unsatisfactory performance, and
unprofessional or disrespectful conduct.
• Youth Opportunity Grievance Form dated 2/25/2025
completed by Youth G: Staff 8 will laugh at youth when they
are mad, will not try to calm youth down, and will say rude
and unprofessional things.
• Staff 1’s personnel file: Staff 1 had no discipline and signed
the Employee Handbook Manual Acknowledgment on
12/26/2024.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: Staff 2 had discipline dated
1/20/2025 for calling into shift without proper notice and
7/19/2024 for having cellphone on shift. Staff 2 signed the
Employee Handbook Manual Acknowledgment on
10/2/2023.
• Staff 3’s personnel file: Staff 3 had discipline dated
4/4/2025 for unexcused absence from work, and two
disciplines dated 1/17/2025 and 12/30/2024 for having
cellphone on shift. Staff 3 signed the Employee Handbook
Manual Acknowledgment on 10/4/2024.
• Staff 4’s personnel file: Staff 4 had one discipline dated
3/20/2025 for unprofessional behavior. Staff 4 signed the
Employee Handbook Manual Acknowledgment on
9/6/2024.
• Staff 5’s personnel file: Staff 5 had two disciplines dated
3/26/2025 for pushing staff and unprofessional behavior.
Staff 5 is no longer employed at the facility.
• Staff 6’s personnel file: Staff 6 had discipline dated
12/29/2022 due to attendance, 5/1/2023 due to sleeping on
shift, and 7/18/2024 due to attendance. Staff 6 completed
Policy and Procedure training on 4/16/2019.
• Staff 7’s personnel file: Staff 7 had no discipline and
completed Professional Ethics and Standards of Conduct
training on 1/7/2024.
• Staff 8’s personnel file: Staff 8 completed Professional
Ethics and Standards of Conduct training on 11/7/2024.
Staff 8 is no longer employed at the facility.
10

• Supervisor’s personnel file: Supervisor had no discipline
and signed the Employee Handbook Manual
Acknowledgment on 7/31/2024.
• Assistant Facility Administrator’s personnel file: Assistant
Facility Administrator had no discipline and signed the
Employee Handbook Manual Acknowledgment on
4/8/2024.
• Chief Administrator’s personnel file: Chief Administrator
had no discipline and signed the Employee Handbook
Manual Acknowledgment on 6/21/2023.
Analysis The facility is found in noncompliance with following their internal
standards of conduct policy as per interviews with staff and youth,
youth and staff report staff have sworn at work, youth have
knowledge of former incidents at the facility regarding incidents
that have occurred and have been informed by staff that the
facility is haunted and staff acknowledge they have told youth, and
the incident where Staff 5 pushed Staff 1 in front of the youth all
tie back to the staff not following the standards of conduct policy
which indicates staff are always expected to maintain ethical and
professional behavior and staff are to interact with youth in a
manner promoting the youths emotional and physical safety while
incorporating trauma responsive practices.
TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE:
It is recommended the facility retrain staff regarding professional
behavior and trauma informed approaches with youth.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SIR 2024SIC0001561 dated 8/14/2024, CAP Approved 9/24/2024
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
5/1/2025
______________________________________
Jennifer Pastorick Date
Licensing Consultant
11

Approved By:
05/06/2025
